subject: Law
title: Service Animals and Public Access
description: A fast breakdown of Service Animals and Public Access for builders.

hook.text: A restaurant says 'no dogs allowed.' But a blind patron has a guide dog. The law says the dog stays.

buildup.text: Under the ADA, service animals trained for specific tasks must be allowed in all public spaces.

discovery.text: Only dogs (and sometimes miniature horses) qualify. Emotional support animals don't have the same legal protections.

twist.text: Businesses can only ask two questions: Is this a service animal? What task is it trained to do? No proof required.

climax.text: Fake service animal claims have surged, making it harder for people with real disabilities to be taken seriously.

punchline.text: Service animals are working tools. The law protects the partnership.

quiz.question: What animals qualify as service animals under the ADA?
